title: Lets talk Lethality
body: Am I the only one who finds it weak? Like no matter how much I build it, I still can't even 1 shot tanks even when I should be. I miss the good old Last Whisper, does anyone know in the near future if Lethality is going to get buffed or something? I have tried a full armor pen build on e.g Jayce and it doesn't seem to do much damage at all I feel.

Tanks have almost no damage potential throughout the entire game, but they have monster tankiness and CCs. Bruisers have good early to mid game damage potential, but their tankiness are more situational and they lack strong and dependable CCs. Fighters' sustainability are either situational or specialised and used primiarly to negate damage during trades rather than focusing on soaking in damage as a whole, and they have much more offence oriented kits, and their CCs are weak and generally nonexistent in a team scale.

Malphite is a Tank. Garen and Poppy are Bruisers. Camille is more or less a Fighter. While how you should deal with your enemies vary from champs to champs, but the general strategies for the 3 subclasses are also fundamentally different as a whole.

But 1 thing is common: All of these subclasses are very vulnerable to poking and are generally powerless to deal with enemies with ranged harass or other similar capabilities.

If you're trying to lane a melee assassin who can't ranged poke against any one of these 3 classes, or that you're playing a ranged AD character and still loses to them, you are doing something wrong, it's simple as that. 

You are not supposed to be able to kill anything just because you have damage, you know. Tankers are not there for you to be there to rack up your kill count, they are supposed to counter damage, that's one of the biggest reasons to why they even exist. If you wanna kill someone, focus squishies, that's what you do, you could also clean up the tank sink once he's alone on his own with you have 4-5 teammates left.

If you've found yourself laning against a tanker with a squishy melee who can't poke, well tough luck either get better team comp next time, trade lanes, or just deal with it and farm+roam, not that hard. Throwing scissors into rocks and wonder why it's not working out isn't how one should be doing this.

> its not hard to outplay a adc as a Camille or poppy, especially poppy.

I do believe this is a common occurrence with *fighter* champions, which both Camille and Poppy are. Fighters do have certain advantages over typical ADC (rather, Physical damage based *marksman* champions) which allow then to do better. Put those same champions against other types of champions and they don't do so well (I believe Assassins do pretty well against Fighters).

> The way someone is allowed to manipulate the champs role by build is whats at question

So, you're just complaining about a core aspect of the game then? Influencing the potential of a champion by choice of items, masteries and runes is a major part of the game and it's *intended* to work like that. It's called "diversity". Be a very lacklustre game if all we ever saw was tanks all using the same 6 items, mages using the same 6 items, assassins using the same 6 items etc.

> the fact lethality is going to be changed "tweaked" w/e is proof

btw garen is listed as fighter

Poppy is also listed as a fighter (secondary), same as Jarvan IV. Garen is listed as a Fighter/Tank. Then again, "subclasses" are not listed in the champion descriptions. You'll notice there is not "class" for "bruiser" (which has previously been discussed). "Subclasses" are just an easier way to categorise various champions beyond Riot's "Role" system, which only has 6 distinct categories (and I believe they said they were changing it).

> the line between the classes and sub classes is becoming very very blurry which is the point. most of that is from item changes. tank fizz anyone.

It's not about item changes, it's about what a champions abilities are based around. Garen, Poppy and Jarvan all have a significant amount of damage despite being categorised as "Tanks", hence why they are also categorised as "Fighters". They're able to work well either way, whether their focus is defence or damage. Then again, they also work better one way (Garen is a better tank, Poppy as well if I'm not mistaken, while Jarvan is a better Fighter).

Tank Fizz has nothing in relation to his abilities, it's simply a matter of items. That doesn't mean Fizz is categorised as a tank, it just means there is a way to play him as one. In fact, you can do that kind of this with basically any champion, and changing items wont impact that enough to make any significant difference. All you need to do is create an ideal item/mastery/rune setup and you can take a given champion out of their "typical" role. Thing is, though, it will work better if the items/runes/masteries compliment the champions abilities.

Please explain again how you are "not meant to stack lethality" and how you came to this conclusion?

As Talon12 said

If it is unnamed like "Unique: +15 Lethality (6.5 - 15 (based on target's level) armor penetration)" then it will stack with passives of the same TYPE like "Unique: +20 Lethality (8.67 - 20 (based on target's level) armor penetration)." from other items, but not if you build the same item twice. 

You can read more about lethality here http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/RYuvnjbT-lethality-info
If you paid attention you would find they do stack, as it is unique not named unique. You can also press C and see that you have ~50 lethality with 3 items.

I'm talking about the out of combat movespeed.

It your hint that you're only supposed to buy one, like how you're only supposed to buy one Sheen item.

You realise that the movement speed stacks too right. Having more than one dirk doesn't stack but the different items do. 

They are both unique passives, so lethality and the out of combat movespeed will all stack, aslong as the item providing it is different to the other items providing it.

Last I checked, unnamed unique passives that grant the exact same stats (for example, the movement speed passives on literally every lethality item) wont stack. Unnamed unique passives will only stack if the stats they grant are different (for example, the lethality granted by Serrated Dirk [10] as opposed to the lethality granted by Duskblade of Draktharr [15]).

Say hypothetically you have a {{item:3147}} and a {{item:3134}}, you would gain 25 lethality and 40 out of combat movespeed, but say instead you have a {{item:3147}} and a {{item:3147}} you would only gain 15 lethality and 20 out of combat movespeed.

Different items that provide the same stats through an unnamed unique passive do stack, while they do not stack if the item is the same.

So having a {{item:3147}} {{item:3814}} {{item:3252}} {{item:3134}} {{item:3142}} will provide 60 lethality and 100 out of combat movespeed. Though technically the movespeed would equate to ~78-87 (averages at 85 though because the cap quickly rises and the average peak is normal 15% reduction but can get to 25%) because the game reduces bonus movespeed by a set amount past a certain limit, thats why when you sometimes you have say {{item:3117}} and three wind dragon buffs you wont get 190 out of combat movement speed and will only get ~161, you can see for yourself it works every game, past a certain threshhold the bonus movespeed is reduced but not removed, this has nothing to do with the out of combat movespeed passive on the item, its just a general rule, where instead of 20 you will get it ranging from 20-15, though it usually (as mentioned before average cap 15%) sits at a 17 gain instead of 20, if i remember right its around a 5%-10% or so effect for every 50 bonus speed after the set cap (which is 420 or something)
